articles.angle: MCP has become the de-facto standard for connecting AI agents to external tools (97M+ monthly SDK downloads). This practical guide gets you from zero to a working MCP server that any major AI assistant can use.

articles.contextForGeneration: MCP (Model Context Protocol) was open-sourced by Anthropic in November 2024 and has been adopted by OpenAI, Google, and the broader AI ecosystem. In December 2025, it was donated to the Linux Foundation's Agentic AI Foundation (AAIF). As of early 2026, MCP has 97M+ monthly SDK downloads and is supported in Claude, ChatGPT, VS Code, Cursor, and many other platforms. The latest spec (2025-11-25) includes async operations, statelessness, and server identity features. Official SDKs exist for TypeScript, Python, C#, and Java. Reference: https://modelcontextprotocol.io and https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/modelcontextprotocol

articles.contextForGeneration: Agentic AI refers to AI systems that can work toward goals with limited supervision by planning steps and using tools. In 2026, the pattern is 'agents plus guardrails' — autonomous capabilities with safety controls. Key APIs: OpenAI's function calling (tools parameter) and Anthropic's tool_use feature. The METR study showed that while developers believe AI makes them faster, autonomous systems need careful design to actually improve productivity. Gartner predicts 40% of enterprise apps will include task-specific AI agents by end of 2026. Reference: https://thenewstack.io/5-key-trends-shaping-agentic-development-in-2026/

articles.contextForGeneration: Vibe coding was named Collins Dictionary's Word of the Year for 2025. As of 2026, 84% of developers use or plan to use AI tools (Stack Overflow 2025 survey), with 51% using them daily. However, a July 2025 METR study found that while developers believed AI made them 20% faster, objective tests showed they were actually 19% slower. AI tools excel at boilerplate code, writing tests, fixing bugs, and explaining unfamiliar code. Security is a major concern — AI tools trained on historical repos lack real-time CVE awareness. Key tools in 2026: Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Devin. Reference: https://www.technologyreview.com/2025/12/15/1128352/rise-of-ai-coding-developers-2026/ and https://devops.com/3-notable-software-development-trends-for-2026-and-beyond/
